content: julbock the swedish christmas goat aka gavlebocken materials worsted weight tan and red yarn stuffing of choice yarn scraps 3 5mm or 4mm crochet hook cardstock thin wire duct tape scissors tapestry needle stitches & techniques slip_stitch slip_stitch chain chain single_crochet single_crochet basic single_crochet increases & decreases magic_ring magic_ring double magic_ring used braiding legs make 4 components round stitches 1 magic_ring 6sc slip_stitch 6 body 2 ch1 6sc blo slip_stitch 6 round stitches 3 ch1 6sc slip_stitch 6 1 magic_ring 6sc slip_stitch 6 4 ch1 6sc slip_stitch 6 2 ch1 increase x6 slip_stitch 12 cut and finish off 3 ch1 increase 1sc x6 slip_stitch 18 neck 4 ch1 18sc blo slip_stitch 18 round stitches 5-10 ch1 18sc slip_stitch 18 1 magic_ring 6sc slip_stitch 6 11 ch1 decrease 1sc x6 slip_stitch 12 2 ch1 6sc blo slip_stitch 6 12 ch1 decrease x6 slip_stitch 6 3-6 ch1 6sc slip_stitch 6 stitch shut cut and sew in cut and finish off snout after round 10 place the end of the body against a piece of cardstock trace and cut out round stitches 2 circles slightly smaller than the end of the 1 magic_ring 6sc slip_stitch 6 body these will support the body s shape place one circle at the start and stuff place the other 2 ch1 6sc blo slip_stitch 6 circle on top of the stuffing and resume with 3 ch1 6sc slip_stitch 6 round 11 cut and finish off assembly to prepare legs tie remaining yarn of each pair of legs together as close to the legs as possible for all non-body pieces stuff the starting yarn back into the piece if the piece is too flimsy you can stuff with yarn scraps be careful not to overstuff the neck as this is where the wire ends will need to sit flip the body over align the knot connecting the legs with the seam sew one pair of legs to each end of the cylinder flip the body back over and sew the neck onto the top front of the body not the front face sew the snout to the front top of the neck beard tail cut 3 4in/10cm pieces of yarn cut 6 6 in/15cm pieces of yarn thread all 3 on tapestry needle thread 3 strands on tapestry needle find middle stitch on bottom of snout use needle find middle three stitches on back of body use needle to thread the 3 pieces of yarn behind it to thread 3 pieces of yarn behind it center the 3 pieces of yarn giving you 6 strands thread remaining 3 strands on tapestry needle to braid find middle stitch on back of body between the already split into 3 groups of 2 combine the two ends of threaded strands and use needle to thread the remaining the middle strand 3 pieces of yarn behind it braid for about 0 5 in/1 cm use a clip to hold split into 3 groups of 4 combine from different groups tie off braid
